page.title: 13MY GRANDA'S BIOGRAPHY.
page.content: My Granda is called William Fewster. He was born on the 22 April 1920 in Everett Street.He was brought up by an elder step brother called John Fewster at 6 Fredrick Street. Life then was poor but the people were friendly and everyone helped each other. At school if you sneezed or coughed you got the cane. His first job was in a shipyard then he was a joiner. In 1935 he joined the Navy. He married Nancy Wilkinson. He served on H.M.S. Southampton when it escorted George VI and Queen Elizabeth to America and Canada. They went to Quebec, New York, Boston, Halifax, Newfoundland and Southampton. He also sailed on H.M.S. Kelly. He remembers Clavering Estate and some of West View as farm land. Clavering was all part of Springwell farm. Angela.
